gurmukhi: ਘਰੀ ਘਰੀ ਟੇਰਿ ਘਰੀਅਾਰ ਸੁਨਾੲਿ ਸੰਦੇਸੋ ਪਹਿਰ ਪਹਿਰ ਪੁਨ ਪੁਨ ਸਮਝਾੲਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gharee Gharee Tayri Ghareeaar Sounaai Sandayso , Pahir Pahir Poun Poun Samajhaai Hai ?
translation: The clock is repeatedly and loudly conveying a message after every watch and every pehar (a quarter of a day/night, that the time is rolling by).

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਭਰਿ ਭਰਿ ਬੇਲੀ ਬੂੜਤ ਹੈ ਪੂਰਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਪਾਪਨ ਕੀ ਨਾਵਹਿ ਹਰਾੲਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Jaisay Jal Bhari Bhari Baylee Boorhat Hai , Pooran Hui Paapan Kee Naavahi Haraai Hai ?
translation: As the water clock sinks repeatedly, 0 human being! you are also sinking your boat of life with ever increasing sins.

gurmukhi: ਚਹੂੰ ਓਰ ਸੋਰ ਕੈ ਪਾਹਰੂਅਾ ਪੁਕਾਰ ਹਾਰੇ ਚਾਰੋ ਜਾਮ ਸੋਵਤੇ ਅਚੇਤ ਨ ਲਜਾੲਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Chahoon Aor Sor Kai Paaharooaa Poukaar Haaray , Chaaro Jaam Sovatay Achayt N Lajaai Hai ?
translation: The True Guru is warning you repeatedly from all directions; O unattentive and senseless person! the four pehars of your night-like life are being spent sleeping in ignorance. You seemed to have no shame of your concern.

gurmukhi: ਤਮਚੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਨਤ ਹੀ ੳੁਘਾਰ ਅਾਂਖੈ ਬਿਨ ਪ੍ਰਿਯ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਰਸ ਪਾਛੈ ਪਛੁਤਾੲਿ ਹੈ ||੬੫੭||
transliteration: Tamachur Sabad Sounat Hee Oughaar Aankhai , Bin Priy Praym Ras Paachhai Pachhoutaai Hai ?657?
translation: O living being! be aware, open your eyes with the crowing of the cock, be attentive after attending to your body needs, taste the elixir of love with the Lord. Without relishing the Naam Amrit of beloved Lord's name, one would feel repentant ultimately.
